content: Shopping mall in Kallang, Singapore **Kallang Wave Mall** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 嘉龙威购物广场) is a [shopping mall](/wiki/Shopping_mall) which is part of the [Singapore Sports Hub](/wiki/Singapore_Sports_Hub) located at [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## Etymology The mall is named as a reference to the Kallang Wave, a wave cheer similar to the [Mexican wave](/wiki/Wave_(audience)) that was commonly seen in the [former National Stadium](/wiki/Former_National_Stadium,_Singapore) that the Singapore Sports Hub replaces. ## History Opened on 27 June 2014, Kallang Wave Mall is part of the Singapore Sports Hub and is integrated into the [National Stadium](/wiki/National_Stadium,_Singapore). Business at the Kallang Wave Mall was poor with original major tenants such as fashion retailer [Forever 21](/wiki/Forever_21) and electronics chain store [Harvey Norman](/wiki/Harvey_Norman) and NTUC Foodfare food court exiting the shopping mall by 2018. Cotton On exited Kallang Wave on 22 August 2025. In 2021, Singapore-based company Esports Entertainment Asia opened an E-sports Experience Centre at Kallang Wave Mall. The Centre has an area of 2,000 square feet (190 m2). Situated at the doorstep of Kallang Wave Mall is [Stadium MRT station](/wiki/Stadium_MRT_station) along the [Circle line](/wiki/Circle_Line_(Singapore)).
